div.p: The library in the digital world
• Most assets have become digital -E.g.: subscriptions to scholarly publications, eBooks catalogues, databases etc.
• But still not in the loop of the publishing workflow -Cataloguing

div.head: -Making available…
div.p: • Online access is transparent to the reader

div.head: • Issues
div.p: -Very little insight in the actual content -The academics have also become digital

div.head: Scientific information workflow
div.p: Working with research data • What should be the role of research libraries?
-Maintaining the link with publications? -Are research data too complex for them?
Consequence for the library The need for a more coherent infrastructure Why is it so difficult?
• Great heterogeneity of format within publishers -Meta data (and full-text) -Proprietary, ScholarOne, NLM 2.0, NLM 3.0, …

figure.figDesc: Digitizing existing assets • Participating in the creation of content -Managing born digital documents • Digital publishing platforms, digital laboratory reports -Managing research data and primary sources?

New roles -articulating research and publishing -Cf. PEER • Management of ("gold") OA deals • Long term preservation • Support for scientific data management • Contribution to the evolution of scholarly communication
